lines.text: Matrimony's an epidemic here and everybody marries millionaires.
There must be something wrong with Daisy. She's the only girl in the original sextet that couldn't land one.
Aw, go lay a brick.
Don't pay any attention to that Lizzie. She smokes cigarettes!
Fanny, please.
Now, dearie, his intentions are not honorable.

[Excitedly]
Oh, yeah!
You little scallywag, you.
Oh, go away with you.
Oh, you've had enough.
[Daisy takes away a pint of beer away from her Pop as he is drinking it]
Wait, now, ducky, I didn't see the bottom.
Hello Fanny. Sit right down, dear. There you are. Now, Oliver, you're the host, so give us a good, lusty swing.
You know, I've known a lot of girls.
So I've heard.
But, I think you're the most charming one I've ever met.
And I think you're all to the mustard too!
Shall we swing higher?
There's nothing to stop us.
That Yale team is certainly a humdinger!
You know, all those things they told you about me having every rich man in town wanting to marry me? Well, that's a lot of popcorn! Nobody wants to marry me, except Georgie Smith.

[Sarcastically]
The important Mr. Smith.
Yes. He works in a cigar store.
So, you don't hate me for a designing woman?
Quite the reverse. From now on, I'm going to have designs on you!
Well, I don't live in a very swell part of town.
I wouldn't care if you lived on Avenue A.
That's where I live!
Go on, have a sip.
No, thanks. My father does all the drinking for our family.
Leaping lobsters!
Are you going anywhere this evening?
Yes! Home to bed.
Oh, I say, we couldn't do that. I-I mean, I-I-I mustn't do - I mean *you* mustn't do that.
Oh, fudge!
You like my dress?
It's ripping!
Where?
Oh, I-I mean it's perfectly ripping!
Tell me, were you in Newport this season?
No, I spent the summer at Coney Island.
